pullRequest.title: Dump container logs on shell command failure
pullRequest.bodyText:
The Docker tests framework captures container logs when Elasticsearch
fails to start. However, it doesn't do this if a later shell command
fails. Amend the DockerShell wrapper to capture the container logs if
a command fails when it should succeed.

commit.message:
Dump container logs on shell command failure

The Docker tests framework captures container logs when Elasticsearch
fails to start. However, it doesn't do this if a later shell command
fails. Amend the DockerShell wrapper to capture the container logs if
a command fails when it should succeed.

nodes.bodyText: We lose the original exception in this scenario and effectively replace it with one about not being able to fetch logs. We should probably still rethrow the original exception and maybe add this one as a suppressed exception.
Even though we are logging the original exception message, we should still add it as the cause to this one, otherwise we lose the original call site stacktrace.
Why are we catching an exception we just threw on the line above? It seems like we are adding an additional stack frame, why?

commit.message:
Throw original exception docker logs capture

When DockerShell.run() catches a ShellException, dump out the logs and
then rethrow the exception, rather than wrapping the original exception.

nodes.bodyText: This is losing the stack trace of the nested exception. Instead we should attach this as a suppressed exception to the original exception
